  "Initiated By" : "MASSACHUSETTS",
  "Allegations" : "THE DIVISION?S REVIEW OF THE APPLICATION REVEALED SEVERAL COMPLAINTS AGAINST SULLIVAN WHICH INCLUDED THE FOLLOWING: A) AN ORAL COMPLAINT FROM A CUSTOMER ALLEGING THAT A PURCHASE OF STOCK WAS UNAUTHORIZED; B) A VERBAL COMPLAINT BY A CLIENT ALLEGING THAT HE HAD LOANED SULLIVAN A SUM OF MONEY, THAT HIS ACCOUNT WAS CHURNED, AND THAT SULLIVAN HAD SOLICITED INTERESTS IN LIMITED PARTNERSHIPS; AND, C) ON OR ABOUT MARCH 11, 2002, FIRST MONTAUK TERMINATED SULLIVAN FOR EXECUTING AN UNAUTHORIZED TRADE IN A CUSTOMER ACCOUNT AND FOR GUARANTEEING THAT ACCOUNT AGAINST LOSS. THE ALLEGATIONS AGAINST SULLIVAN RESULTED IN THE PLACEMENT OF CONDITIONS ON SULLIVAN?S REGISTRATION AS AN AGENT OF CPC BY THE DIVISION.",
  "Resolution" : "Consent",
  "SanctionDetails" : [ ],
  "Sanctions" : "THE DIVISION APPROVED SULLIVAN?S APPLICATION FOR REGISTRATION IN MASSACHUSETTS AS AN AGENT OF CPC UPON THE CONDITIONS SET FORTH BELOW, WHICH ARE EFFECTIVE FOR TWO YEARS: A) SULLIVAN SHALL BE SUPERVISED, ON A HEIGHTENED BASIS; B) CPC SHALL NOT PERMIT SULLIVAN TO HAVE ANY PRINCIPAL, SUPERVISORY, OR MANAGERIAL DUTIES WHILE ASSOCIATED WITH CPC; C) CPC SHALL NOT PERMIT SULLIVAN TO POSSESS OR EXERCISE DISCRETION IN THE HANDLING OF MASSACHUSETTS CUSTOMER ACCOUNTS; D) ON A QUARTERLY BASIS, CPC SHALL MONITOR AND REPORT ON SULLIVAN?S MASSACHUSETTS CUSTOMERS WITH RESPECT TO  THE CUSTOMER?S SATISFACTION WITH SULLIVAN?S SERVICES; E) SHOULD SULLIVAN BECOME THE SUBJECT OF ANY WRITTEN OR ORAL CUSTOMER COMPLAINT CONCERNING ALLEGATIONS ARISING FROM HIS CONDUCT OF SECURITIES BUSINESS, CPC SHALL NOTIFY THE DIRECTOR, IN WRITING, WITHIN TEN (10) BUSINESS DAYS OF CPC?S RECEIPT OF SUCH COMPLAINT; F) SHOULD SULLIVAN BECOME THE SUBJECT OF ANY REGULATORY INVESTIGATION, INTERNAL INVESTIGATION, ARBITRATION PROCEEDING, OR SECURITIES-RELATED LITIGATION CONCERNING ALLEGATIONS ARISING FROM HIS CONDUCT OF SECURITIES BUSINESS, CPC SHALL NOTIFY THE DIVISION. ",
